Mohammed VI, a king with big foreign policy plans
subhead: 'The Enigma of Mohammed VI' (4/6). In recent years, the Moroccan monarch has become highly active on the international stage. From the highly sensitive issue of Western Sahara to Morocco's rapprochement with Israel, he has often established himself as the central player.

After LA and DC deployments, Trump wants wider National Guard role in law enforcement
subhead: By ordering the creation of a special unit in each of the 50 states to maintain public order on Monday, August 25, the Republican president aims to normalize the presence of military personnel in the streets and to federalize public security policy.

title: Live death of French streamer: 'It took a tragedy and a media storm to force the government to act'
subhead: The system for regulating online content cannot function without strong political will, argues the president of the Human Rights League in an op-ed. In February, she unsuccessfully appealed to the French media and digital communications regulator regarding Jean Pormanove, who died during a livestream on the Kick platform.

title: At the Venice Film Festival, French filmmakers take on literary adaptation
subhead: Valérie Donzelli, François Ozon, Cédric Jimenez and Olivier Assayas are all presenting films adapted from novels at the Mostra, running from August 27 to September 6.

title: Macron ignored reports advising against transport of Bayeux Tapestry
subhead: Le Monde has learned that two expert reports from 2021 and 2022 warned against transporting the millennium-old artwork, which is to be loaned to Britain and exhibited in London in September 2026.

title: Jacques Rancière, philosopher: 'Today, the people fueled by resentment manufactured by billionaires dominate the public sphere'
subhead: 'May '68 Thinkers Reflect On Trump Era' (1/6). The philosopher of emancipation examines the roots of the current reactionary offensive. He views contemporary utopian micro-communities as new ways of 'living as equals.'

title: Life in the West Bank settlement of Kedem Arava: 'We're not taking anyone's place, there is only sand around us'
subhead: Established in 2017 near the Jordanian border, the Kedem Arava settlement contains prefabricated homes housing some 60 families, former city dwellers seeking a life closer to nature. While most residents deny ideological motivation, their presence fully aligns with the annexation of Palestinian territory sought by the Israeli far right.
